thread.title: Real estate the best bet for the next few years
thread.title_full: Real estate the best bet for the next few years | afr.com

author: Patrick Commins
title: Real estate the best bet for the next few years
text:
Real estate still looks the relative asset winner in the next year or two, says Bank of America-Merrill Lynch. Henry Zwartz by Patrick Commins In those countries which experienced a housing crash during the global financial crisis, investors and homeowners are growing increasingly confident. While emerging market currencies recently fell to their lowest level since 2009, new home sales in the US rose to their highest level since 2008, and house prices are rising in the US, Europe, Japan and China. Indeed, real estate still looks the relative asset winner in the next year or two, says Bank of America-Merrill Lynch.
The dividend yield on the ASX 200 is above 5 per cent, the highest level since 2012. But for the past four years dividend growth among Australian listed companies has outstripped earnings growth, point out analysts at Morgan Stanley. Payout ratios have been stretched to multi-year highs of 75 per cent, well above the average of 65 per cent.
